abstract: Cuba is allowing more private enterprise, and United States is raising amount of remittances that Americans can send to residents; still, influx is only widening gap between haves and have-nots, and between whites and blacks; economists say whites are 2.5 times more likely than blacks to receive remittances, stranding many in decrepit, impoverished neighborhoods.
lead_paragraph: The American reconciliation with the country is expected to increase the pace of private development, as well as the gap between haves and have-nots.

headline.main: Inequality Becomes More Visible in Cuba as the Economy Shifts
headline.print_headline: As Cuba Opens Door to Private Enterprise, Inequality Rushes in

snippet: The American reconciliation with the country is expected to increase the pace of private development, as well as the gap between haves and have-nots.
